column11:
This table provides the Spring 2019 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, by school. It tracks both undergraduate and graduate credit hours, applies “graduate extra credit,” and converts them into standardized FTE counts.

By School (Spring 2019):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences – the largest unit, with 51,731 total credit hours, supporting about 3,322 FTEs.

Business – generated 17,471 credit hours, equating to 1,054 FTEs.

Education & Professional Studies – produced 16,923 credit hours, translating into 673 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – contributed 37,471 credit hours, for 2,317 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – instructional hours at each level.

Graduate Extra Credit – weighting adjustment for graduate courses.

Grand Total Credit Hours – overall credit load including adjustments.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – standardized enrollment equivalents (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
